January 1947

NATIONAL CONVENTION

267

Mr. Smallwood l was wondering the past few weeks what the four members from Placentia Bay were looking so happy about. I think it may be because these four gentlemen have succeeded in getting a whole lot of things for Placentia Bay, They are getting a new boat, and a new bait depot, and a new cottage hospital, so that must be why they are so happy. They have even got roads, a

couple of million dollars will be spent on them. Mr. Chairman, I move that the committee rise, report progress and ask leave to sit again.

[The committee of the whole rose and reported progress. The Convention received and adopted the report of the Committee on Transportation and Communications, and adjourned until the call ofthe Chair]
